text:
<@U0K8ZSHN0> and I just had a great chat with Dennis Veatch (Industrial Designer and manufacturing expert)
TL;DR: really excited about the entire concept and implementation ideas. He’s interested in potential investment or partnership with PMMC to level-up his business. He’d be an excellent advisor for the current phase of the process.
next step is to reconnect him with <@U026NB2U2> and team to have a more detailed discussion around business model and what his involvement might look like
Lee took good notes, so he has the action item to send them to the channel

Notes from our meeting with Dennis Veatch:
- Packaging aspect is most often forgotten in product design, can consume 15-20% of BOM
- Overseas manufacturing can be costly due to unexpected secondary and tertiary costs
- He will try to get us a tour of manufacturing floor of Triad Speakers
- A lot of manufacturing is being “reshored” due to implementation of lean manufacturing (aka Kaizen the Toyota mfg methodology)
- Selective Laser Sintered parts or 80-90% as strong as injected molded parts (from his recent experience)
- We should look into the Freelancers Union as potential partner for PMMC
- Reduced friction around operation of machinery is the key to effective use of machines (read: need expert operator(s))
- Ideal desk share day for him: coffee -> light social interaction -> desk with connectivity -> place to meet incoming customer where presentation can be shown -> ability to point out PMMC partnerships in mfg plan -> work on 3D model and book time with trusted operator to produce (trusted implies high confidence in quality output) -> confer with battery life expert about effect on industrial design -> bookkeeping service takes care of costing out to different resources within PMMC (batt expert, SLS operator, IP legal services, etc.)
happy to explain any bullet notes that might be unclear
Also of note, the educational aspect really struck a chord with Dennis. This is the one aspect I love most about Portland vs. my experience with LA/SF people. People here seem to care about community
Stuck out with Robert from zgf as well.
